intro: Synnema, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its dense, yellowish-green foliage that resembles a misty cloud. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Synnema thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, where it forms a symbiotic relationship with its host. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
